item.title: Angel of Death and 12 Strong Horse Soldier
item.description: A story of bravery and resilience featuring the Angel of Death and a 12-strong cavalry unit. Witness courage and strategy in a remarkable military tale.

media:content.media:title: Angel of Death and 12 Strong Horse Soldier
media:content.media:description: A story of bravery and resilience featuring the Angel of Death and a 12-strong cavalry unit. Witness courage and strategy in a remarkable military tale.

item.title: Medal of Honor: Single-Handed Enemy Take Down
item.description: A heroic account of a soldier receiving the Medal of Honor for taking down an entire enemy position alone. Courage and valor in action.

item.title: Marine Vet Recounts Horrifying Afghan Attack
item.description: Andrew Biggio, a Marine Corps sergeant, shares a chilling firsthand account of an attack on Afghan soldiers during his service in Iraq and Afghanistan.

item.title: Cruel Tricks Faced by POWs in Germany
item.description: A veteran recalls the harsh and deceptive tactics used by German forces on prisoners of war during World War II, highlighting resilience under extreme conditions.

item.title: How Mail Boosted WW2 Frontline Morale
item.description: Explore how letters and packages kept soldiers’ spirits high during World War II, providing comfort, connection, and hope amid challenging frontline conditions.

item.title: How Close Is Close Quarters Combat?
item.description: A detailed look at close quarters combat, showing the intense proximity and fast-paced action soldiers face in confined environments during military operations.

item.title: Witnessing a Town’s Destruction
item.description: A firsthand account of witnessing a town being destroyed, highlighting the intense reality and emotional impact of conflict on communities and civilians.

item.title: WWII Marine’s Story: Sealing Caves, Facing Shadows
item.description: A WWII Marine recounts the dangers of sealing enemy caves and confronting hidden threats, sharing the courage and tension of frontline combat experiences.

item.title: Why I Lied to My Vietnamese Captors
item.description: A veteran shares the reasons behind deceiving his captors during captivity in Vietnam, revealing survival tactics and the mental challenges faced as a POW.

item.title: Gene Simmons on Mother’s Holocaust Survival
item.description: KISS legend Gene Simmons shares his mother’s harrowing Holocaust survival story. A powerful reflection on resilience, family, and history.

item.title: What I Saw on Omaha Beach Haunts Me
item.description: A veteran shares haunting memories from Omaha Beach on D-Day. Hear firsthand accounts of courage, fear, and the lasting impact of that historic battle.

item.title: Flight 1549: Sully Sullenberger Remembers
item.description: On this day in 2009, Flight 1549 made an emergency landing on the Hudson River. Bear Grylls speaks with Captain Sully Sullenberger about that heroic, nation-captivating moment.

item.title: American Valor: Sully Sullenberger
item.description: Celebrate the heroism of Sully Sullenberger, the pilot who safely landed Flight 1549 on the Hudson River. A story of courage, skill, and American valor.

item.title: People Ask, “How Many Men Did You Kill?”
item.description: A veteran reflects on the difficult question of combat and kill counts. Hear the personal story, context, and the realities of war beyond the battlefield.

item.title: WWII Vet Brad Beeler on German Snipers
item.description: WWII veteran Brad Beeler shares his harrowing experiences with German snipers. From Normandy to Germany, hear firsthand stories of courage and survival on the front lines.

item.title: B-17 Pilot’s Heroic Move in WWII
item.description: A B-17 pilot made a daring decision to ensure his crew’s safety during WWII. Hear the heroic story of courage, quick thinking, and sacrifice in the skies.

item.title: Realizing I Was a Quadruple Amputee
item.description: A powerful and emotional moment of realization. Hear the firsthand story of facing life as a quadruple amputee and the resilience it takes to move forward.

item.title: Famed Journalist Remembers the Battle of Ia Drang
item.description: A renowned journalist reflects on the Battle of Ia Drang. Hear firsthand accounts, insights, and memories from one of Vietnam’s pivotal conflicts.

item.title: Rocky Bleier: From Vietnam to Super Bowl Glory
item.description: Rocky Bleier overcame severe Vietnam War injuries to return to football, joining the Steelers and winning four Super Bowls. A story of determination, resilience, and triumph.

item.title: When Eating Pages Became a Choice in Vietnam
item.description: A Vietnam War veteran recalls the extreme hardships soldiers faced, where eating pages became a desperate survival choice. A raw and unforgettable firsthand story.
